DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Clearance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to a creatinine laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Clearance Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate._The result of an action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Creatinine Clearance Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.:The result of an action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the clearance of endogenous creatinine, used for evaluating the glomerular filtration rate.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study creatinine clear
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 30 ml/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to the upper limit of normal or is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m^2 (for patients with creatinine levels above the institutional normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5X institutional normal, within 8 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL AND is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is greater than or equal to 18 years old is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockroft-Gault; if patient is less than 18 years old (pediatric patient) does serum creatinine based on age and gender meet the criteria in the table in section 3.1.7?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is greater than or equal to 18 years of age, is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockroft-Gault; if patient is less than 18 years of age (pediatric patient) does serum creatinine based on age and gender meet the criteria in the table in section 3.1.7?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2, unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine or measured or calculated or calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) less than 1.5 × institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 × institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for subjects with Gilbert's syndrome or genetic equivalent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 × institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR is calculated creatinine clearance (Cockcroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 45 ml/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min.?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5x upper limit of normal (ULN) OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50mL/min according to Cockcroft Gault formula or other institutional methods?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 ml/min (GFR can also be used in place of creatine clearance (CrCl)), within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min (using the CKD-EPI formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured creatinine clearance within 2 weeks of enrollment greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study Cockcroft calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min OR is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5x institutional ULN OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min by Cockcroft-Gault OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 given this is a cisplatin-ineligible patient population) within 14 days prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 50 mL/min OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL AND is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine	less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) is greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (by CKD-EPI)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 ml/min (based on the calculated CKD-EPI glomerular filtration rate estimation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 30 mL/min based on the Cockroft-Gault glomerular filtration rate (GFR) estimation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study measured creatinine clearance greater than 60 mL/min OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2020-8-3 AQT added for P10398. AK  11/14/19 ls
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 7/21/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT.wz
